text: It's automatic. Yo out can't change yhem

Hi Everyone! Has anyone created a hubdb that pulls in different results per blog post? I have done it on pages without any issues, but I donâ€™t think you can with a blog post as there does not seem to be a way to set up different ways to filter per post. Anyone have any experience doing something like this?
I got it all figured out. I am just dumb sometimes
what did you do - post it here for the next one of us! :slightly_smiling_face:

in blog post template
```{{ content.name }}```
it return
```<span id="hs_cos_wrapper_name" class="hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_meta_field hs_cos_wrapper_type_text" style="" data-hs-cos-general-type="meta_field" data-hs-cos-type="text">Things aren't as they normally are, they are better.</span>```
instead of
```Things aren't as they normally are, they are better.```
I imagine this is so that you can inline edit text. I figure using `content_by_id` would give you the raw title?

Hi

hs-search-results.....

Is there a way to pull in the tags/topics on the search results page?

<@UCTAN7RPA>, I've been using this condition for a while and it works well :slightly_smiling_face:
```{% if request.postDict.inpageEditorUI %}
  Your HTML here
{% endif %}```

playing around with with data, I found you can also use `buffer_mode.is_template_preview == true` to also show on template preview as well.
```{% if request.postDict.inpageEditorUI or buffer_mode.is_template_preview %}
  Your HTML here
{% endif %}```
